Gabriel LeeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 12 Oct 2018 Liquidation refers to selling off one's assets. E.g. A company who is facing cash flow problems may liquidate to get cash. A recent example would be the bike sharing operator oBike which went into liquidation after they decided to exit the Singapore market. 0 comments1

ProdigyAnswered on 12 Oct 2018Liquid assets in finance refers to cash and near cash (things that you can convert to cash very quickly without loss).​Liquidation in finance means to sell off assets to produce cash. It is usually done to pay off debts.0 comments0

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Liquidate in financial terms means to sell off assets, like stocks or property, usually in an unwilling manner due to present circumstances 2 comments0

Question Poster12 Oct 2018What’s the factors to consider before liquidating an asset?Jonathan Chia Guangrong12 Oct 2018Do you have holding power? Can you take care of your situation with liquid savings? If yes, then perhaps there's no need to liquidate your assets. Are you also selling off the asset at a gain or loss? If the latter, you may want to put off the asset selling unless you really need toe funds to settle the current situation
